importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott went missing on this date, and a stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the same day. The car was later found on fire, linking it to Keon King's movements.
The stolen vehicle was reported to be on fire on this date, and the fire occurred three days after Scott’s disappearance, raising suspicion of arson or foul play involving Keon King.
The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date, after an anonymous tip led authorities to re-examine the abandoned school site.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeline around October 4, 2025, includes the reported theft of the Hyundai Accent and the last known cellphone location of Keon King, which coincided with Kada Scott’s disappearance.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman missing for two weeks, were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and causing or risking a catastrophe, with a bail of $2.5 million.
DNA testing confirmed that the remains found belong to Kada Scott, and authorities believe King had contact with her via cellphones, with location data matching her disappearance.
A black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen one day before Scott vanished and was later found on fire, with King’s cellphone tracking showing activity at a recreation center on the night of the theft.
Investigators believe the fire may be arson, and that further charges are in the works, with possible involvement of other people still under investigation.
King was previously arrested in a separate kidnapping case, though charges were dropped due to lack of witness appearance.
Kada Scott, who worked in an assisted living facility, was remembered by her parents as a person of kindness and light, and their hearts were described as 'shattered' by her disappearance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing in Philadelphia on October 4, 2025, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school after an anonymous tip prompted investigators to re-examine the site. DNA testing confirmed her identity. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and other offenses. Cellphone data and video evidence show that King had contact with Scott and that his vehicle—a stolen black Hyundai Accent—was seen at a recreation center on the night of her disappearance. The car was later found on fire, with investigators suspecting arson. Prosecutors believe King may have been involved in her disappearance, and additional charges are being pursued. While King was previously arrested in a separate kidnapping case, those charges were dropped due to witness non-appearance. Kada Scott’s parents described her as a person of kindness and light, and expressed deep grief over her loss. Authorities say further investigation is underway into possible involvement of other individuals.
title: Remains found behind abandoned school belong to missing Philadelphia woman, Kada Scott, officials say
